items.title: Ex-poker player Bord is preferred Sheff Wed bidder
items.summary: Former professional poker player James Bord is chosen as the preferred bidder for Sheffield Wednesday, BBC Sport can confirm.

items.title: Sunderland vs Leeds live on Sky: Longstaff and James out, Nmecha could return
Wednesday takeover administrators grant 'preferred bidder' status to consortium
items.summary: The administrators of Sheffield Wednesday have announced they intend to grant preferred bidder status to a consortium ahead of a takeover of the club.

items.title: Het jaar van Telstar en Correia: dit is de man achter de stuntclub
items.summary: Met de promotie naar de Eredivisie en een winstpartij bij PSV zorgde Anthony Correia (43) voor de twee grootste voetbalstunts van het jaar. En dat deed de trainer van Telstar op geheel eigen wijze. ‚ÄòVolharding is onze grote kracht.‚Äô

items.title: Franse amateurs krijgen gigantische donatie van noodlijdend Olympique Lyon
items.summary: In het Franse dorp Saint-Cyr-au-Mont-d'Or worden het buitengewoon vrolijke kerstdagen. De plaatselijke voetbalclub heeft een gigantische donatie gekregen van Olympique Lyon, naar aanleiding van de recente onderlinge bekerwedstrijd tussen beide ploegen.

items.title: Man Utd latest: Club have to be certain of players to sign, says Amorim
Joey Veerman gooit transferdeur dicht en blijft bij PSV
FC Groningen verlengt contract van zelfopgeleide aanvaller
items.summary: Thom van Bergen blijft langer bij FC Groningen. De zelfopegeleide aanvaller uit Haren heeft getekend onder een contract dat hem tot medio 2028 verbindt aan de Trots van het Noorden , zo is woensdag wereldkundig geworden.

items.title: Afcon roundup: Tapsoba seals dramatic injury-time comeback for Burkina Faso
items.summary: Burkina Faso win 2-1 against 10-man Equatorial Guinea Two goals in three minutes of added time cap turnaround Edmond Tapsoba headed Burkina Faso to a dramatic 2-1 Africa Cup of Nations victory over 10-man Equatorial Guinea as they struck twice in stoppage time to snatch the points. The Stallions dominated the first half of the opening Group E encounter at the Stade Mohammed V in Casablanca, with Sunderland‚Äôs Bertrand Traor√© and Brentford‚Äôs Dango Ouattara causing problems down the flanks, but ultimately had nothing to show for their efforts at the break. This story will be updated later on Continue reading...

items.title: Amorim challenges Manchester United to ‚Äòstep up‚Äô after Bruno Fernandes injury
items.summary: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs impossible to replace Bruno ‚Ä¶ we need more leaders‚Äô United host Newcastle in Premier League on Boxing Day Ruben Amorim has described Bruno Fernandes as ‚Äúimpossible to replace‚Äù but has told Manchester United‚Äôs players the captain‚Äôs injury is a chance for them to step up. Fernandes was forced off at half-time of Sunday‚Äôs loss at Aston Villa owing to a soft-tissue injury that will rule him out for a prolonged period. United host Newcastle in Boxing Day‚Äôs only Premier League fixture and Amorim was asked how he could compensate for Fernandes‚Äôs absence when the 31-year-old‚Äôs deputy, Kobbie Mainoo, is also injured. items.title: Are we heading for a Littler vs Humphries showdown at Ally Pally?
items.summary: Are we heading for a Luke Littler vs Luke Humphries final at the World Darts Championship and why are so many seeds tumbling out at Ally Pally?

items.title: 'Impossible to replace' - Fernandes could miss up to a month
items.summary: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says it is "impossible" to replace Bruno Fernandes as he faces up to a month without him.

items.title: Bruno Fernandes tijdelijk uitgeschakeld, hoop voor De Ligt
items.summary: Bruno Fernandes kan voorlopig niet in actie komen voor Manchester United. De 31-jarige Portugees raakte zondag geblesseerd aan zijn hamstring in het verloren duel met Aston Villa. Voor Matthijs de Ligt is er meer hoop.

items.title: Bar√ßa's Bonmat√≠ aims for April return to training
items.summary: Aitana Bonmat√≠ said that breaking her leg is giving her the chance to relax for the first time in five years after topping ESPN FC Women's Rank for the third time in a row.

items.title: Arsenal survive 'emotionally tough' Palace shootout
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said it was "emotionally tough" to accept Crystal Palace's stoppage-time equaliser before his team went on to win 8-7 on penalties following a 1-1 draw in their Carabao Cup quarterfinal.

items.title: NWSL OK's 'Rodman rule' even as union objects
items.summary: The NWSL on Tuesday announced the creation of what has been referred to internally as the "High Impact Player" rule (HIP), which would allow teams to spend up to $1 million outside of the salary cap on star players.

items.title: USMNT's Richards stretchered off in Carabao Cup
items.summary: Crystal Palace and United States defender Chris Richards was taken from the field on a stretcher during his team's Carabao Cup game against Arsenal on Tuesday.

items.title: Amorim: Impossible to replace Fernandes amid injury absence
items.summary: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says it is "impossible" to replace Bruno Fernandes as the captain faces a spell on the sidelines with a muscle injury.

items.title: 'Always hungry, always brave' - why Man City want Semenyo
items.summary: Every transfer window, there is a player whose future becomes the defining saga of the month. This January, it looks set to be Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo.

items.title: Enticing Salah would be a coup for Saudi league searching for an identity
items.summary: Egypt forward could change face of a league so far mostly reliant on ageing stars and alter perception of football in the Arab world Mohamed Salah has made an impact in Morocco with an injury-time winner to spare Egypt‚Äôs blushes in their Africa Cup of Nations opener against Zimbabwe but his future intervention in Saudi Arabia could be more meaningful. A Saudi Pro League (SPL) that had been moving away from signing big-name veterans is tempted by a player who will be 34 just as this season ends. Although players such as Cristiano Ronaldo and Karim Benzema have been successes on and off the pitch, albeit incredibly expensive ones, the powers that be don‚Äôt want the SPL to be regarded as a retirement league in the sun for stars whose powers are waning. But Salah is different, the attraction intensified by the fact that he is the biggest-name player in the Arab world. Continue reading...
